title: Shea Farrell
text:
Edward Leo "Shea" Farrell III is an American actor and producer best known for playing Mark Danning in <a href="Aaron%20Spelling">Aaron Spelling</a>'s series, "<a href="Hotel%20%28American%20TV%20series%29">Hotel</a>".
Shea Farrell was born October 21, 1957 in <a href="Cornwall%2C%20New%20York">Cornwall, New York</a>, to Edward Leo, Jr. and Mary Rose (née Drummey) Farrell. He attended <a href="Portsmouth%20Abbey%20School">Portsmouth Abbey School</a> in <a href="Portsmouth%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Portsmouth, Rhode Island</a>. He originally planned to be a professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player.
Shea switched from acting to production work in 1997. He worked on "<a href="The%20Practice">The Practice</a>", "<a href="Ally%20McBeal">Ally McBeal</a>", "<a href="Boston%20Public">Boston Public</a>" and "<a href="Boston%20Legal">Boston Legal</a>", all produced by <a href="David%20E.%20Kelley">David E. Kelley</a>. He now works in films and on television as an <a href="assistant%20director">assistant director</a> and <a href="unit%20production%20manager">unit production manager</a>. He has been a Unit Production Manager Sony Entertainment's New Media Division/Crackle.com since 2008.
